sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
Create a search using SQL-like syntax to return items that match specific metadata.

Inputs:

  • From - Specifies the template used in the query. Must be in the form scope.templateKey
  • Ancestor Folder ID - List of owners User ID, defined as a list of comma separated user IDs Eg. 123422,23532,3241212.
  • Query - Query to perform. A query is a logical expression that is very similar to a SQL SELECT statement Eg. value >= :amount.
  • Orderd By - List of template fields and directions to sort the metadata query results by.
  • Use Index - Name of the search index to use for this query.
  • Query Params - Set of arguments corresponding to the parameters specified in the query.

Outputs:

  • Files and Folders - Returns List of searched content.
    • ID
    • Type
    • E-Tag
    • Item Status
    • Size
    • Name
    • Shared Link
    • Download URL
    • Access
    • Parent ID
  • Status - Will be set to "Success" if the request succeeds or "Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is "Error".

Error Messages:

  • Invalid username or password/token.
  • User with the specified login already exists.
  • Invalid input parameters in request.
  • The credentials associated with the Box Spoke connection does not have enough permission to perform this action.

To use this action, the corresponding Box connection and credential must be created and associated with the Box Connection & Credential alias. Learn More

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
